content: @WG-prioritization let's start the pre-triage
ah wa swondering whether the meeting moved to another time :D
The triage meeting will happen in #t-compiler/meetings > [weekly meeting] 2020-05-28 #54818

DPC said:

ah wa swondering whether the meeting moved to another time :D

yeah did not agree on that but maybe next week we can change it
I have created the agenda we will be building during this meeting
let's get this started

Unprioritized I-prioritize

  1. All unprioritized I-prioritize

    - Add T-compiler or libs-impl tag when it corresponds.
    - Do a sanity check on them.

Issues

Empty

  1. T-compiler

    - Prioritize issues and remove nomination of the ones not worth discussing.
    - Tag regressions accordingly.
    - Ping appropriate people and/or ICE-breakers.

Issues

Empty

  1. libs-impl

    - Prioritize issues and remove nomination of the ones not worth discussing.
    - Tag regressions accordingly.
    - Ping appropriate people and/or ICE-breakers.

Issues

Empty
as expected
we probably want to start skipping this step

Regressions

  1. Beta regressions without P-label

    - Prioritize.
    - Ping appropriate people and/or ICE-breakers.
    - Assign if possible; if it remains unassigned, add it to agenda so we can assign during the meeting.

Issues

Empty

  1. Nightly regressions without P-label

    - Prioritize.
    - Ping appropriate people and/or ICE-breakers.
    - Assign if possible; if it remains unassigned, add it to agenda so we can assign during the meeting.

Issues

Empty

  1. Stable regressions without P-label

    - Prioritize (once we have this under control).
    - Ping appropriate people and/or ICE-breakers.
    - Assign if possible; if it remains unassigned, add it to agenda so we can assign during the meeting.

Issues

Empty
ok there's something wrong here
there are stable to stable regressions but script says empty
anyway, let's not worry about that
we won't be doing anything related to this
we should be adding as we were doing during our last meeting 4 more I-prioritize to our stable to stable list of issues
if someone want to do that please go ahead

Stable nominations

  • All stable nominations
    - Add T-compiler, libs-impl or T-rustdoc tag when it corresponds.
    - Do a sanity check on them.

Issues

Empty

Beta nominations

  • All beta nominations
    - Add T-compiler, libs-impl or T-rustdoc tag when it corresponds.
    - Do a sanity check on them.

Issues

Empty
nothing there neither

I-nominated

  1. All I-nominated

    - Add T-compiler or libs-impl tag when it corresponds.
    - Do a sanity check on them.

Issues

  • "tag/niche terminology cleanup" #72497
  • "Stabilize #[track_caller]." #72445
  • "Report error when casting an C-like enum implementing Drop" #72331
  • "add raw_ref macros" #72279
  • "Integer overflow on String::drain() with an inclusive range" #72237
  • "Add a MustUse trait to complement #[must_use]" #71816
  • "Async execution can get lost during refactoring" #71368
  • "Regression in usable type complexity: overflow representing the type ..." #71359
  • "Ungreat change to doctest test names" #70090
  • "Perform WF-check on types with no type parameters" #69741
  • "Breaking Change in Vec::truncate drop order between 1.40 -> 1.41" #68709
  • "nth_back() for Zip returns wrong values" #68536
  • "Backtrace is <unknown> for dynamic library loaded through dlopen using absolute file path for rust >= 1.37.0 on OSX" #67599
  • "Stabilize the #[alloc_error_handler] attribute (for no_std + liballoc)" #66740
  • "Context and Waker might be accidentally Sync" #66481
  • "Tracking issue for RFC 2523, #[cfg(version(..))]" #64796
  • "COPYRIGHT file is wildly out of date" #63232
  • "f32 formatter produces strange results" #63171
  • "Arc::drop has a (potentially) dangling shared ref" #55005
  • "rustdoc disregards job limit" #53143
  • "Tracking issue for RFC 2344, "Allow loop in constant evaluation"" #52000
  • "doctests marked with 'no_run' permit ICEs" #49514
  • "Tracking issue for DST coercions (coerce_unsized, unsize) stabilization" #27732
let's check if there is some nomination not tagged with T-compiler that is for us there

Santiago Pastorino: we should be adding as we were doing during our last meeting 4 more I-prioritize to our stable to stable list of issues

Santiago Pastorino: if someone want to do that please go ahead
i m sorry i didnt get what is expected :/ could you please elaborate ? :/
sure, so from the list of stable to stable regressions without p-label
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues?q=is%3Aopen+label%3Aregression-from-stable-to-stable+-label%3AP-critical+-label%3AP-high+-label%3AP-medium+-label%3AP-low+-label%3AT-infra+-label%3AT-release
this list
we should tag 4 issues with I-prioritize
the idea is to get that list to zero
but we don't want to prioritize 21 issues at once + all the issues that come up during this week
I think 4 more is manageable
ok thanks ! I ll gloss through the list and flag 4 of them
and by doing this + all new stable to stable issues getting tagged automatically as I-prioritize soon we will have this list empty

Santiago Pastorino said:

I-nominated

  1. All I-nominated

    - Add T-compiler or libs-impl tag when it corresponds.
    - Do a sanity check on them.

Issues

  • "tag/niche terminology cleanup" #72497
  • "Stabilize #[track_caller]." #72445
  • "Report error when casting an C-like enum implementing Drop" #72331
  • "add raw_ref macros" #72279
  • "Integer overflow on String::drain() with an inclusive range" #72237
  • "Add a MustUse trait to complement #[must_use]" #71816
  • "Async execution can get lost during refactoring" #71368
  • "Regression in usable type complexity: overflow representing the type ..." #71359
  • "Ungreat change to doctest test names" #70090
  • "Perform WF-check on types with no type parameters" #69741
  • "Breaking Change in Vec::truncate drop order between 1.40 -> 1.41" #68709
  • "nth_back() for Zip returns wrong values" #68536
  • "Backtrace is <unknown> for dynamic library loaded through dlopen using absolute file path for rust >= 1.37.0 on OSX" #67599
  • "Stabilize the #[alloc_error_handler] attribute (for no_std + liballoc)" #66740

back to this ^^^
nothing there
let's move on

1. I-nominated T-compiler

    - Remove leftovers from last meeting.
    - Do a sanity check on them.

Issues

  • "tag/niche terminology cleanup" #72497
this is not a left over
and seems fine as nomination
let's continue

1. I-nominated libs-impl

    - Remove leftovers from last meeting.
    - Do a sanity check on them.

Issues

  • "Regression in usable type complexity: overflow representing the type ..." #71359
  • "nth_back() for Zip returns wrong values" #68536
  • "Backtrace is <unknown> for dynamic library loaded through dlopen using absolute file path for rust >= 1.37.0 on OSX" #67599
those nominations were not discussed during last meeting
we did not have time if I remember correctly
let's check the meeting just in case
removed #71359 since it was already discussed

PR's waiting for on team

  1. All PR's waiting on team

    - Add T-compiler or libs-impl tag when it corresponds.
    - Do a sanity check on them.

Issues

  • "Report error when casting an C-like enum implementing Drop" #72331
  • "Print environment variables accessed by rustc as special comments into depinfo files" #71858
  • "Implement Default for MaybeUninit" #71821
  • "Perform WF-check on types with no type parameters" #69741
that seems ok

1. PR's waiting on T-compiler

    - Explicitly nominate any that you think may be able to be resolved quickly in triage meeting.

Issues

  • "Print environment variables accessed by rustc as special comments into depinfo files" #71858
that seems ok

1. PR's waiting on libs-impl

    - Explicitly nominate any that you think may be able to be resolved quickly in triage meeting.

Issues

Empty
script have dumped the agenda and have pasted it in hackmd
fixing some style issues
ok more or less done
we can check the agenda quickly now
https://hackmd.io/YId0E8pKS26g6dx1-JGn7Q?both
to see if more or less make sense
and to check how packed it is
we have 6 P-critical issues :S
well there are at least 2 duplicates of others
let's continue

Announcements

  • Check the compiler calendar to see if there's an outstanding event to announce.

Nominate issues

Check how packed the agenda looks like and if there's room for more, consider the following ...

  • All Stable-to-beta regressions
    • Check if there are relevant issues that are worth raising awareness.
    • Assign if possible; if it remains unassigned, add it to agenda so we can assign during the meeting.
  • All Stable-to-nightly regressions
    • Check if there are relevant issues that are worth raising awareness.
    • Assign if possible; if it remains unassigned, add it to agenda so we can assign during the meeting.
  • P-high issues
    • unassigned
added announcements from calendar
ok let's move on

Toolstate

  • Check toolstate for outstanding tool breakage.
    • Notify teams in the corresponding channels
clippy, RLS and rustfmt are failing cc @DPC
I notified the respective teams last week
didn't get any PRs, so i'll do with higher urgency

Performance regressions

  • Add Triage Logs to the agenda
    • https://github.com/rust-lang/rustc-perf/tree/master/triage#triage-logs
  • Check perf regressions.
    • Notify involved actors.
(RLS and rustfmt have a PR, it's waiting-on-author iirc)
#72055 caused perf regressions for wf stress tests, this is already being worked on
going to add the perf log to the agenda
so I guess that's more or less all

Yuki Okushi said:

(RLS and rustfmt have a PR, it's waiting-on-author iirc)

Those probably need to be updated i think
I wanted to spend some minutes talking about how can we improve this process
but maybe we do want to have a specific meeting about that?
I think this particular meeting is making less and less sense as we automate things and move some stuff async
do we want to schedule a meeting and see how can we improve?
I can focus on progressively adding I-prioritize labels if that makes sense (asynchronously that is)

DPC said:

Yuki Okushi said:

(RLS and rustfmt have a PR, it's waiting-on-author iirc)

Those probably need to be updated i think

yeah, iirc it just needs small tweak so pinging author is enough, I think
We could delegate each part to a different member of the group, and then ping each member asking for updates
does this next monday 8pm UTC works?
june 1st
btw i d love to see a dashboard or something that would allow us to know how many open issues have what labels, would that be worth pursuing ?
jeremy, that's already possible with github labels

o0Ignition0o - Jeremy Lempereur said:

btw i d love to see a dashboard or something that would allow us to know how many open issues have what labels, would that be worth pursuing ?

what I would like to see is with some metrics, how the work done by this group is helping in general
unless you mean the counts, then no and a dashboard will be useful for purposes not just beneficial to this group but other groups
well by that i mean somewhere where i can have a quick look and see how we're doing, and if we can flag more issues as to prioritize for example

Santiago Pastorino said:

o0Ignition0o - Jeremy Lempereur said:

btw i d love to see a dashboard or something that would allow us to know how many open issues have what labels, would that be worth pursuing ?

what I would like to see is with some metrics, how the work done by this group is helping in general

like in particular we would be taking unprioritized regressions to zero
metrics on this regard may be hard to get, like at the end we want to avoid bad issues hitting stable versions but yeah that would be hard to measure I guess
anyway, something that we could/may talk during next meeting
so this monday 8pm UTC
if people have time what we need to do for tomorrow is check the agenda and see if nominations and all the stuff that is there makes sense
I'm going to go over that too but if somebody wants to help more than welcome :)
this is all, thanks everyone for attending :wave:
I have a clash for Monday but I can skip the other one not a problem :slight_smile:
added the meeting to the compiler calendar
have set 1h, maybe that's a lot but I guess we can see what do we want to discuss!
